question: In Lmna “progerin-only” knock-in mouse models, is the engineered allele enriched for cis-acting splicing elements that promote the HGPS-associated cryptic splice event compared with the wild-type Lmna locus? Answer with Yes or No.

content.source_1: Targeted genomic mapping of the Lmna progerinonly knock-in allele revealed clusters of exonic splice enhancers adjacent to the activated cryptic splice site, consistent with an abundance of sequences that promote the alternative splicing responsible for HGPS.
content.source_2: Hutchinson-Gilford progeria syndrome (HGPS) is a childhood premature aging disease caused by a spontaneous point mutation in lamin A (encoded by LMNA), one of the major architectural elements of the mammalian cell nucleus.
content.source_3: After the aberrant splice was corrected and nuclear morphology normalized in HGPS fibroblasts, comparative motif analysis found no enrichment of alternative-splicing regulatory sequences within the progerinonly Lmna allele relative to wild type.
